caption: Algorithm 3: The Weighted Majority Algorithm with Non-uniform Initial Weights
description: This algorithm uses a weighted majority approach to prediction, where each expert's weight is initially set inversely proportional to its index.  After each prediction, the weights are updated based on whether the prediction was correct.  Experts that consistently make inaccurate predictions will have their weights diminish over time, leading to a greater influence of more accurate experts in future predictions.

caption: Table 1. Summary of the results.
description: This table summarizes the findings of the paper regarding the characterization of concept classes that are optimistically universally online learnable.  It shows which conditions (on concept classes and data processes) are necessary and sufficient for optimistic universal learnability under different scenarios (realizable and agnostic cases).
